publications.title: One-shot imitation in a non-stationary environment via multi-modal skill
publications.abstract: We propose a multimodal semantic skill learning framework for one-shot imitation learning in non-stationary environments. The approach enables agents to adapt quickly to new tasks through multi-modal skill representation and transfer.

publications.title: Incremental Learning of Retrievable Skills For Efficient Continual Task Adaptation
publications.abstract: Continual Imitation Learning (CiL) involves extracting and accumulating task knowledge from demonstrations across multiple stages and tasks to achieve a multi-task policy. We present IsCiL, an adapter-based CiL framework that addresses the limitation of knowledge sharing by incrementally learning shareable skills from different demonstrations, thus enabling sample-efficient task adaptation.
publications.related_project: Self-directed Multimodal Intelligence for Solving Unknown, Open-Domain Problems

publications.title: NeSyC: A Neuro-symbolic Continual Learner For Complex Embodied Tasks In Open Domains
publications.abstract: We present NeSyC, a neuro-symbolic continual learner that emulates the hypothetico-deductive model by continually formulating and validating knowledge from limited experiences through the combined use of LLMs. NeSyC enables embodied agents to tackle complex tasks more effectively in open-domain environments.
publications.related_project: Self-directed Multimodal Intelligence for Solving Unknown, Open-Domain Problems

target_journals: IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems

achievements.neurips_2024: Published at NeurIPS 2024 - one of the top-tier AI conferences
